page.title: 07Swimbridge School
page.content: The school was built in 1866 with an additional classroom added in 1929. Prior to this lessons were held in the 'Old Schoolroom' adjacent to the church still used for church and other activities. Children from 5-11 are admitted and there are close links with the village playgroup, the Church ( the school has a church 'aided' status), and three other local schools. The school is organised into three classes according to age with an average of 25 children in each. In 1981 there were 36 children on roll; later this year (1985) there will be 80. Meals are cooked on the premises and children go to the Barnstaple Leisure Centre for swimming instruction each week. The Jubilee Hall is used each week for Country Dancing and P.E.
